intro: Asperula paui, commonly known as the dwarf sweet pepper, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Asperula paui is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments. It is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
